title.narrative: ACCESS PRESCHOOL, FORMAL/ NON-FORMAL SCHOOLS

description.narrative: By 2019, more children, girls and boys, aged 3-15 years are provided with preschool, formal and non-formal schools, meeting their needs., which contributes to Children With Disabilities, Early Childhood Development, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Learning Outcomes, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022,children aged 3-15 years, girls and boys, are in a supportive environment and benefit from inclusive quality education that integrates local distinctiveness

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2019, more children, girls and boys, aged 3-15 years are provided with preschool, formal and non-formal schools, meeting their needs.

description.narrative: Inclusion has been integrated in the Education Management Information System, and a sector-wide strategy on inclusive education is now validated. UNICEF's contribution to the building of 29 community-based pre-school centres as well as to support minor repairs, equipment and in-kind dotation, with positive discrimination towards girls, has contributed to give an equal chance in school readiness and success to all children of the convergence municipalities. Each municipality has identified its out-of-school children and has developed a budgeted strategy to get them into school. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019
